w4160.game

Class SimpleGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • w4160.game.SimpleGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IControlLogic

    public class SimpleGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements IControlLogic
    A simple implementation of the IControlLogic interface. It defines the high-level logic of an interactive graphics application, including how to initialize, how to response user input (mouse clicks and key strokes), and how to display content.
    See Also:
    IControlLogic

      • respond_key_action

        public void respond_key_action(long window,
                               int key,
                               int scancode,
                               int action,
                               int mods)
        This function responds to the state changes of keys. Different from the input method, this function is triggered when there is a key state change---for example, press a key or release a key. When the key is holding, this function won't be triggered.
        Specified by:
        respond_key_action in interface IControlLogic
        See Also:
        input(Window, MouseInput)

      • input

        public void input(Window window,
                  MouseInput mouseInput)
        This function responds keys "continuously". For example, when the user is pressing the key, this function will respond to the key pressing at each game loop. Effectively, holding the key down will keep triggering the key response implemented in this function.

        This differs from the respond_key_action method, which is triggered only when the key states are changed.

        Specified by:
        input in interface IControlLogic
        See Also:
        respond_key_action(long, int, int, int, int)
